Description: Pink limestone figure of a hippopotamus; a pierced and hollowed projection emerges from the back. The ears are represented by small protuberances which have a small drill hole in the center. A triangular tail is carved at the rear. The projection on the back is pierced by 4 holes.
Curator's comments: Published: A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo, (Ravenna 1998), pp.176-177 [107]. X. Droux, Twinned hippipotamus figurines of the Predynastic period, in: R. Friedman and P. Fiske (eds), Egypt at its Origins 3, OLA 205, (Leuven, 2011), pp. 366-8, fig. 14, table 2 entry 11a. D. Patch, Dawn of Egyptian Art (New York, 2012), p.39, cat. no. 26 This piece is similar to a figure in New York (MMA 23.3.30), but it is not its twin, but both were probably carved by the same craftsman. Another very similar hippo figurine is in Birmingham 1969W4701.
Exhibition history: 1 Mar - 28 Jul 1998.Ravenna, Italy Museo Nazionale di Ravenna, ‘Kemet: Le origini Dell’Antico Egitto’ 2012, Apr-Aug. New York, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, Dawn of Egyptian Art.
